verses.kjv: Woe to thee that spoilest, and thou wast not spoiled; and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee! when thou shalt cease to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled; and when thou shalt make an end to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.
verses.web: Woe to you who destroy, but you weren’t destroyed, and who betray, but nobody betrayed you! When you have finished destroying, you will be destroyed; and when you have finished betrayal, you will be betrayed.
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for you, destroyer — you who have never been destroyed yourself! Disaster for you, betrayer — you who have never been betrayed! When you're done destroying, you will be destroyed. When you're done betraying, you will be betrayed.

verses.kjv: O LORD, be gracious unto us; we have waited for thee: be thou their arm every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.
verses.web: LORD, be gracious to us. We have waited for you. Be our strength every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.
verses.ct: LORD, be gracious to us — we've been waiting for you. Be our strength every morning and our salvation when trouble comes.

verses.kjv: At the noise of the tumult the people fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.
verses.web: At the noise of the thunder, the peoples have fled. When you lift yourself up, the nations are scattered.
verses.ct: When your thunderous voice roars, nations flee. When you rise up, peoples scatter in every direction.

verses.kjv: And your spoil shall be gathered like the gathering of the caterpiller: as the running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them.
verses.web: Your plunder will be gathered as the caterpillar gathers. Men will leap on it as locusts leap.
verses.ct: Your plunder will be swept up the way caterpillars strip a field bare. People will swarm over it like a wave of locusts.

verses.kjv: The LORD is exalted; for he dwelleth on high: he hath filled Zion with judgment and righteousness.
verses.web: LORD is exalted, for he dwells on high. He has filled Zion with justice and righteousness.
verses.ct: The LORD is exalted, for he lives on high. He has filled Zion with justice and righteousness.

verses.kjv: And wisdom and knowledge shall be the stability of thy times, and strength of salvation: the fear of the LORD is his treasure.
verses.web: There will be stability in your times, abundance of salvation, wisdom, and knowledge. The fear of LORD is your treasure.
verses.ct: He will be the stability of your times, a rich source of salvation, wisdom, and knowledge. The fear of the LORD — that is your greatest treasure.

verses.kjv: Behold, their valiant ones shall cry without: the ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.
verses.web: Behold, their valiant ones cry outside; the ambassadors of peace weep bitterly.
verses.ct: Look — their bravest warriors are crying in the streets. The ambassadors sent to negotiate peace are weeping bitterly.

verses.kjv: The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceaseth: he hath broken the covenant, he hath despised the cities, he regardeth no man.
verses.web: The highways are desolate. The traveling man ceases. The covenant is broken. He has despised the cities. He doesn’t respect man.
verses.ct: The highways are deserted; no one travels them anymore. The covenant has been broken. Cities are despised, and human life counts for nothing.

verses.kjv: The earth mourneth and languisheth: Lebanon is ashamed and hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness; and Bashan and Carmel shake off their fruits.
verses.web: The land mourns and languishes. Lebanon is confounded and withers away. Sharon is like a desert, and Bashan and Carmel are stripped bare.
verses.ct: The land mourns and wastes away. Lebanon is disgraced and withering. Sharon has become a desert, and Bashan and Carmel are stripped bare.

verses.kjv: Now will I rise, saith the LORD; now will I be exalted; now will I lift up myself.
verses.web: “Now I will arise,” says LORD. “Now I will lift myself up. Now I will be exalted.
verses.ct: "Now I will rise," says the LORD. "Now I will lift myself up. Now I will be exalted."

verses.kjv: Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your breath, as fire, shall devour you.
verses.web: You will conceive chaff. You will give birth to stubble. Your breath is a fire that will devour you.
verses.ct: You conceive plans that are nothing but chaff, and all you produce is stubble. Your own breath will become a fire that devours you.

verses.kjv: And the people shall be as the burnings of lime: as thorns cut up shall they be burned in the fire.
verses.web: The peoples will be like the burning of lime, like thorns that are cut down and burned in the fire.
verses.ct: Whole peoples will be burned to powder like limestone in a kiln, like cut thorns thrown into a blaze.

verses.kjv: Hear, ye that are far off, what I have done; and, ye that are near, acknowledge my might.
verses.web: Hear, you who are far off, what I have done; and, you who are near, acknowledge my might.”
verses.ct: "You who are far away — hear what I have done! You who are nearby — acknowledge my might!"

verses.kjv: The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness hath surprised the hypocrites. Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?
verses.web: The sinners in Zion are afraid. Trembling has seized the godless ones. Who among us can live with the devouring fire? Who among us can live with everlasting burning?
verses.ct: The sinners in Zion are terrified. Trembling has gripped the godless. They cry out, "Who among us can survive a devouring fire? Who among us can endure everlasting flames?"

verses.kjv: He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from seeing evil;
verses.web: He who walks righteously and speaks blamelessly, he who despises the gain of oppressions, who gestures with his hands, refusing to take a bribe, who stops his ears from hearing of blood, and shuts his eyes from looking at evil—
verses.ct: The one who lives righteously and speaks with integrity — who refuses to profit from oppression, who waves away bribes, who refuses to listen to plots of murder, and who shuts his eyes against evil —

verses.kjv: He shall dwell on high: his place of defence shall be the munitions of rocks: bread shall be given him; his waters shall be sure.
verses.web: he will dwell on high. His place of defense will be the fortress of rocks. His bread will be supplied. His waters will be sure.
verses.ct: that person will live in safety on the heights. A fortress of rock will be his refuge. His bread will be provided, and his water will never run dry.

verses.kjv: Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty: they shall behold the land that is very far off.
verses.web: Your eyes will see the king in his beauty. They will see a distant land.
verses.ct: Your eyes will see the king in all his beauty. You will gaze out over a vast and distant land.

verses.kjv: Thine heart shall meditate terror. Where is the scribe? where is the receiver? where is he that counted the towers?
verses.web: Your heart will meditate on the terror. Where is he who counted? Where is he who weighed? Where is he who counted the towers?
verses.ct: Your mind will look back on the terror and wonder, "Where is the officer who kept the records? Where is the one who weighed the tribute? Where is the one who counted the towers?"

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not see a fierce people, a people of a deeper speech than thou canst perceive; of a stammering tongue, that thou canst not understand.
verses.web: You will no longer see the fierce people, a people of a deep speech that you can’t comprehend, with a strange language that you can’t understand.
verses.ct: You will no longer see those fierce invaders — that people whose language was so foreign you couldn't understand a word of it.

verses.kjv: Look upon Zion, the city of our solemnities: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle that shall not be taken down; not one of the stakes thereof shall ever be removed, neither shall any of the cords thereof be broken.
verses.web: Look at Zion, the city of our appointed festivals. Your eyes will see Jerusalem, a quiet habitation, a tent that won’t be removed. Its stakes will never be plucked up, nor will any of its cords be broken.
verses.ct: Look at Zion, the city where we celebrate our appointed festivals! Your eyes will see Jerusalem as a peaceful home — a tent that will never be taken down. Not one of its stakes will ever be pulled up, and none of its ropes will ever snap.

verses.kjv: But there the glorious LORD will be unto us a place of broad rivers and streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass thereby.
verses.web: But there LORD will be with us in majesty, a place of wide rivers and streams, in which no galley with oars will go, neither will any gallant ship pass by there.
verses.ct: There the LORD will be with us in all his glory, like a place surrounded by wide rivers and streams — yet no warship with oars will sail on them, and no mighty vessel will pass through.

verses.kjv: For the LORD is our judge, the LORD is our lawgiver, the LORD is our king; he will save us.
verses.web: For LORD is our judge. LORD is our lawgiver. LORD is our king. He will save us.
verses.ct: For the LORD is our judge. The LORD is our lawgiver. The LORD is our king. He will save us.

verses.kjv: Thy tacklings are loosed; they could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread the sail: then is the prey of a great spoil divided; the lame take the prey.
verses.web: Your rigging is untied. They couldn’t strengthen the foot of their mast. They couldn’t spread the sail. Then the prey of a great plunder was divided. The lame took the prey.
verses.ct: As for your enemies — their rigging hangs loose, their mast can't be secured, and their sail can't be spread. When the time comes, even the lame will carry off massive plunder.

verses.kjv: And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniquity.
verses.web: The inhabitant won’t say, “I am sick.” The people who dwell therein will be forgiven their iniquity.
verses.ct: No one living there will say, "I am sick." The people who dwell in that place will have their sin forgiven.
